item.title: Health | Services warn of “more active” chickenpox viruses
item.description:
The government yesterday launched an alert to the increase of costumes of chickenpox in Macao. Since the beginning of the year, authorities have reported 195 cases of infection, almost double the same period of 2024. About three quarters of infections are contracted by children
Macao's varicella virus is becoming more active, health services have indicated yesterday, appealing to parents, educational institutions, and day care centers to be aware of symptoms and adopt a preventive stance. According to data on communicable declaration diseases, authorities found that last week there was a “trend to increase the number of varicella cases, with the weekly average of 12 cases from April 6 to rise to 23 last week”. The body led by Alvis Lo points out that "this number is higher than that of last year's same -year period (10 cases)." Authorities also account for a case of collective chickenpox infection that was recently detected at Pui Ching Secondary School, affecting a total of 21 students. From May 1, students "had symptoms of rash and small bubbles on the head, face, limbs, back and chest, having undergone medical treatment." Authorities add that there were no serious complications and that "most patients were vaccinated with a dose of chickenpox." From the beginning Between January 1 and May 6 this year, 195 cases of chickenpox were recorded in Macao, a number that almost doubled infections during last year's same year, when 105 cases were registered. About three quarters of cases concern children, most ages between 8 and 17 years old, representing 65.1 percent of the total, while people aged 7 or under or less represent only 6.1 percent of the total. Health services highlight that since the beginning of the year there has been no record of serious or deadly cases. Authorities add that part of the inoculated population against the chickenpox is still likely to be affected by what health professionals call disruptive infection. However, "symptoms are usually slight and atypical, with fewer bubbles and the duration of the disease is relatively short." According to the government, the cases of chickenpox at Pui Ching secondary school are disruptive infections.

item.title: WYNN MACAU | Operational profits shrink more than one third
item.description:
Wynn Macao had $ 127.1 million operational profits in the first quarter, 38.3 percent in annual terms. The game operator learned in the two casinos that has $ 720 million in revenues, less 12.2 percent compared to the first three months of 2024
Wynn Macau yesterday announced financial results for the first quarter of 2025, which reveal a significant break from operational profits, less 38.3 percent, to a total of $ 127.1 million. According to a statement issued by the game concessionaire, the two properties operated by the company registered revenues of $ 865.9 million between January and March, a 13.3 percent drop compared to the same period of 2024. Betting in Wynn Macau and Wynn Palace casinos were responsible for the company's $ 720 million in revenues, 12.2 percent than in First quarter of last year. Craig Billings, a mother's executive director, American Wynn Resorts, said in the same statement that the big gamblers were more lucky than usual in the first quarter, something that "negatively affected the results." In this segment, known as VIP game, the bets decreased only 1.25 percent in the two Wynn Macau casinos, but the revenues fell much more, 34.4 percent in homologous terms, to $ 120.2 million. On average, Macao casinos manage to raise at least 3 percent of the bets in the VIP game, but this value fell to 1.09 percent in the first three months of the year, in the case of the Wynn Macao Casino. The so-called mass market continued to be from afar the main segment for the operator, representing revenues of $ 710.9 million between January and March, 6.9 percent less than in the same period as 2024. It is recalled that in 2019 VIP represented 46.2 percent of the total revenues of Macao casinos. But in the first three months of the year this segment was a slice of 25.1 percent. The world outside Wynn Resorts, which is building a Casino hotel in the United Arab Emirates, said it continues to "explore opportunities to develop more business or related games in the domestic and international market." In a teleconference with analysts, after the announcement of the results, Craig Billings, acknowledged that the company could compete for new concessions for casinos in Japan, but only "if the conditions were adequate." Billings also gave as an example Thailand, a country that is discussing the legalization of casinos and described as "an incredible market, with air transport, infrastructure, tourism, etc. unbelievable." Billings said he did not expect any impact on Wynn Macao from the trade war created by the tariffs imposed by the United States on imports from China, Hong Kong and Macau. On Tuesday, the Financial Notation Agency Fitch Ratings considered that the trade war could damage play operators in Macau, which are “subject to retaliation” and vulnerable to Chinese economic slowdown.

item.title: Administration | Ng wai han leaves from SAFP to drive dicj
item.description:
With the passage of Adriano Marques Ho to customs services, the direction of inspection and coordination of games began to be led interim by its sub-director Lio Chi Chong. The secretary for the economy and finances yesterday appointed NG Wai Han, the first woman at the head of the regulating entity of the Macao game
The Game Inspection and Coordination Directorate (DICJ) has a new director. An order signed by the secretary for the economy and finance, Tai Kin IP, published yesterday in the official bulletin, names NG Wai Han as director of DICJ for a one year period. The NG Wai Han Service Commission began just yesterday with the publication of the order. It is recalled that the position had been vacant since Adriano Marques Ho was taken to the post of Customs Director General in December, during the reformulation of the holders of high public positions with the inauguration of the new Sam Hou Fai government. To the place of Adriano Marques Ho, who has directed Dicj since June 2020, the new executive appointed sub-director Lio Chi Chong. Ng Wai Han became the first woman in the leadership of the DICJ, after the exercise of Manuel das Neves, Paulo Martins Chan and Adriano Marques Ho. The rise of the former director of administration and civil service services to the top of the DICJ hierarchy marks a difference in the profile of leaders, which have so far come from the area of ​​security forces. WORK AND ADMINISTRATION The Secretary for Economics and Finance states that “NG Wai Han has professional competence and aptitude to exercise the position of director of the Directorate of Inspection and Game Coordination, which is demonstrated by Curriculum Vitae”. The new leader of the game regulatory entity in the territory is a law degree from the University of Sun Yat-Sen, where he also made a master's degree in Criminal Law. In 1999, he entered the civil service, to the position of Higher Technique (legal area) of the Directorate of Services for Labor Affairs (DSAL), where it remained until 2013. Between 2013 and 2016, headed the Divisions of Study of the Department of Studies and Informatics and Labor Rights Control of the Department of Labor Inspection. In May 2016, he began to lead the Labor Inspection Department and a year later was appointed subdirect, substitute of DSAL, and subdirecting until 2020, when it moved to the administration and civil service services after two decades in DSal. Between June 2020 and August 2023, Ng Wai Han was the subdirect of SAFP and a month later went to the SAFP, a position he held until yesterday.

item.title: Childhood Subsidy | Says it is an incentive for birth
item.description:
Babies born this year will receive, in the first three years of life, a total of 87 thousand patacas in the context of the concession of the new childhood allowance. Hon Wai, president of the Institute of Social Action, defended yesterday that this new measure can promote the growth of the birth rate
Preparations are underway for the creation of a new support for families who wish to have more children, and which has been announced in the last lines of governing action (LAG) for this year. As stated yesterday Hon Wai, president of the Institute of Social Action (IAS), in the Macao Forum Morning Program, of the Chinese channel of Radio Macau, this measure can even contribute to an increase in birth. "We hope that this subsidy can encourage local families to have children. Of course to increase birth we have to consider various aspects, and with this allowance we hope to be able to give some financial support to alleviate the economic pressure of Macao families. We launched the childhood assistance allowance, and to increase the birth system," he said. In the case of a child born this year, the childhood allowance implies the government's attribution of a total of 87,000 patacas in three years, taking into account the monthly amount of 1,500 patacas. The 87,000 patacas that children born this year will receive concern childhood allowance added to birth and pecuniary checks. The recipients of the childhood assistance allowance have to be permanent residents, including babies born in 2022. As mentioned, it is a new support that reaches 15,000 babies and children. At this stage, IAS works in the elaboration of the administrative regulation, as the measure should come into force at the time of summer. The monthly amount serves mainly to relieve the burden of families with essential expenses such as the purchase of diapers, milk powder or food, having been calculated based on the data provided by the Consumer Council. "We are based on the Consumer Council in view of the average prices of baby goods, so we estimate weekly costs of around 900 to 1,300 patacas," he said on the program. After a preliminary analysis, the government has decided that registrations will be made through the Macao Single Account platform, as it has the essential information of parents and children. Hon Wai also pointed out that information about the basic structure of this support is already defined and can be available in the single account. "We foresee that thousands of parents are covered by the program and can request the subsidy at the same time, so IAS needs to ensure the platform's operation and ensure questions such as cybersecurity," he said. Study on day care centers In the same program, IAS Early Childhood Work Chief Team, Wong In Leng confirmed that IAS will study the search for the demand for day care centers and facilities available for children under two years. Wong in Leng also assured that in addition to being reinforced training for professionals who take over children, an external assessment will be made at the institutional level in order to ensure the quality of day care centers. The official concluded that IAS annually assigns more than 240 million patacas to subsidized day care centers, and each vacancy is supported by 34 thousand patacas. Nurseries offer more than 900 free places.

item.title: Saint Lazarus | NG I Weng exhibition to see by the end of the month
item.description: It is evident, by the end of the month, in Gallery 10 Fantasia, in the neighborhood of São Lazaro, the exhibition of artist NG I Weng. It is an initiative of several entities, namely the Macao Youth Art Association, Society of Artists of Macao, Association of Promotion of Creative Industries of the District of São Lázaro, and Gallery 10 Fantasia-Incubator of Creative Industries. The artist was born in Macao in 1993, having formed in 2015 at the Department of Fine Arts and Cultural Creative Design at Huafan University in Taiwan. According to an official note about the show, the artist has been, since “tender age”, a “curious person about life, having a rich emotional depth”. Thus, his artistic work "explores themes of humanity, emotional links and nature through various ways, revealing a particular proficiency in oil and acrylic painting." NG I Weng participated in several shows, such as the Huafan Dalun Mountain University Art Exhibition in 2013; The HUASHAN Undergraduate Exhibition in 2015; and also the exhibition of works of art of the members of the Society of Artists of Macau. The artist, who also does curator work, belongs to various artistic entities, such as the Macau Artists Society, Macao Visual Art Education Association or Macao Reading Promotion Association, among others.

item.title: Timorese specialist considers urgent domain of Portuguese for national cohesion
item.description: Timorese linguist Benjamin Real Corte considered yesterday that the Portuguese language is a factor of cohesion in Timor-Leste and is a “national urgency” that all citizens will dominate. Benjamin Real Corte spoke at the seminar on “Linguistic Policies and Development of the Portuguese Language in Timor-Leste: Challenges and Perspectives”, organized by the National University of Timor-Leste, under his 25th anniversary and the celebrations of World Portuguese Language Day, which was signaled on May 5. In his speech, the teacher recalled that before the arrival of the Portuguese, the Timorese were scattered by tribal groups, who spoke their own language, and that the communities were isolated from each other, also because of the mountainous relief of the region. "The arrival of the Portuguese comes to bring a novelty that is the introduction of an element that will precisely dilute our previous situation of isolation of communities. Since the Portuguese language entered Timor, it has served this purpose of uniting the Timorese communicatively," said Benjamin Corte Real. And, according to the linguist, although it was not introduced in the same way as Indonesian language, whose learning was a matter of survival, the Timorenses, especially the leaders, realized that to unify the country and consolidate national independence to “Portuguese language was essential”. National urgency Another reason pointed out by Benjamin Real Cut for the importance of Portuguese for “national cohesion” is that maternal or local languages ​​do not “have enough resourcefulness to absorb administrative practice, for legislative production for territory planning”. Today, he stressed, although national cohesion has not been achieved in terms of widespread mastery of the Portuguese language, it has already begun to realize that the state must walk in this direction and make a "more proposed" effort so that Portuguese is dominated by all. “This is a national urgency. Therefore, we are here to appeal to all the instances of education throughout the territory that assume their responsibility and comply with the laws and enforce the laws around the implementation of Portuguese language teaching and teaching through Portuguese,” said Benjamim Corte Real. "We cannot speak of a harmonized, unified society, without investing in the language that is common to all of us. We must do it by obligation, national vocation, and, above all, also by constitutional mandate," he insisted.

item.title: AMCM | Mobile transactions go up in the 1st quarter
item.description: Data from the Macao Monetary and Currency Authority (AMCM) show that in the first three months of the year increased the number of mobile payment transactions in Macau as well as its value. Thus, the number of transactions of this type was 90.4 million, an increase of 11.6 percent compared to the first trimester of 2024. In addition, the value of these mobile payments was 7.9 billion patacas, plus 8.7 percent over the same period last year. Until late March this year, a total of 108,749 devices and units, including “QR code” supports, accepted mobile payments. AMCM data also show that in the use of credit cards there was also an increase in the number of transactions, totaling 11.8 million, an increase of 9.7 percent compared to the first quarter of 2024. In addition, the number of transactions made with debit cards was 1.2 million, with a total value of transactions of 464.9 million patacas. It should be noted that these values ​​for the use of debit cards do not include cash surveys in atm boxes.

item.title: PME | Events promoted by Melco generated $ 1 million
item.description:
Melco Resorts claims to have generated about $ 1 million for small and medium -sized local businesses through events promoted last year. In the 2024 sustainability report, the game operator also highlights the results in terms of waste management and energy spending
The Melco Resorts & Entertainment Sustainability Report has just been published last year, which highlights the gains obtained by small and medium -sized (SMEs) with the events promoted by the operator. With regard to the “community engagement and investment” part, it is read that “more than $ 1.02 million for local companies and [NGO] non-governmental organizations in Macao through 21 SME events, with 603 SME and NGO participants” were generated. In addition, in the volunteering area, Melco points out that "about 3,600 participants offered their time and effort in more than 359 volunteering initiatives," "more than $ 17.42 million that were donated to decent causes in our communities." Quoted by the report, Lawrence Ho, Melco's president and executive director, says that "21 Heart of House initiatives and community events have generated more than $ 1 million for local companies in Macao, providing 603 SMEs and NGO opportunities to connect, expand and grow." According to the official, last year were "in -depth partnerships with PME and NGO". Regarding the relationship with local SMEs, Melco also highlights the connection with the supply chain, because “86 percent of acquisitions arose from local companies in Macao”, and of this total, “59 percent were local SME acquisitions”. Similar scenario occurred in the other operators that Melco holds in Cyprus and Manila, with local acquisitions around 40 and 76 percent, respectively. Regarding the company's training actions, Melco says it has invested on average "582 US dollars per full -time worker in learning and development activities, which is equivalent to an average of 38 hours of training." In this context, “100 percent of colleagues participated in training actions”, can be read. In addition, "over 758,000 participants have attended more than 1,400 courses offered by" Melco Learning Academy ", which is equivalent to over 870,000 hours of learning." Also noteworthy is that, in all Melco projects, "women represent 23 percent of the boards of business and 32 percent of the higher paintings." The report also tells that “63 percent of positions at the vice-presidency level, or above this post, were filled from local communities, increasing to 70 percent in Macao”, can read. All for the environment Another of the areas highlighted in Melco's sustainability report concerns environmental policies. One of the areas that is “in progress” is the energy consumption, in order to obtain more reasonableness of consumption. "In 2024, despite an increase of 39 percent in terms of the number of visitors and the rise of 19 percent in the occupation rate of the hotel rooms, along with the addition of a property and a new resort integrated into our portfolio, the energy intensity increased by 10 percent from 2023, but was 19 percent lower than our year of reference 2019." One of the “achieved” objectives is the energy efficiency measures, which “since 2018 has resulted in an annualized savings of more than 62.5 million kWh, an increase of 9 percent compared to 2023”. Another "achieved" goal concerns the installation of "over 25,000 photovoltaic panels on all properties in Macau, Manila and Cyprus, generating about 10,000 kWh annually." Thus, in the properties of Melco "the electricity consumption from renewable sources increased by 72 percent compared to 2023". Regarding the group's means of transportation, “buses, electric and hybrid vehicles represent 55 percent of our combined fleet, with loading stations, an increase of 25 percent compared to 2023”. In terms of materials and waste management, Melco says it has avoided plastic spending in the order of 13.2 million bottles, thanks to the installation of “the Nordaq water filtering system that serves almost every hotel rooms in Melco Integrated Resorts”. In addition, the example of the City of Dreams venture in Manila is presented where “a circular economy system was established in which food waste is decomposed on site, and the excess donated to a local fifth to cultivate some of the vegetables served to guests”. In terms of water consumption, the report indicates that “despite the increase in the number of visitors and the hotel occupancy rate”, “total water consumption and water intensity increased only 6 and 2 percent compared to 2023, respectively, and were 6 and 30 percent lower, respectively, to the 2019 reference year”. However, this is a goal that, according to the company, is still "in progress". Another objective highlighted in the report was the “annual economy of over 510,820 cubic meters of water through water efficiency measures, an increase of 10 percent compared to 2023 ″. "As we invest in people and communities, we continue to derive environmental efforts with the same determination. (…) The intensity of energy and water consumption, as well as greenhouse gas emissions, remained significantly below our 2019 base line, even adding a new property and an integrated resort," says Lawrence Ho. The entrepreneur also referred to the increase "of the amount of valuable materials diverted through recycling and composting in global operations - 58 percent over last year." “In our restoration spaces we also fight food waste, with the 'clean dish challenge' to contribute to a 9 percent reduction in waste in the Macao and Manila restoration areas.” “Mentality change” For Lawrence Ho, greater sustainability in Melco requires "a change of mindset" verified in "small actions that, on scale, can have a significant impact." Regarding the supply chain of the group's integrated hotels and resorts, good results are also highlighted. "Although the numbers do not always show exponential heels, our focus on responsible supply remains unshakable, 18 percent of all seafood bought by weight to be sustainable sources, and 100 percent of our points of sale of food and beverage in Macau and Manila to serve eggs of outdoor chickens," he reads. There is thus "an effort that reflects a deeper ambition to incorporate sustainability into acquisitions," said Lawrence Ho, who added that "more than one service, hospitality has to do with the experience it creates, the people it supports and the impact it leaves." “Every year, Melco challenges himself to go further, believing that luxury and responsibility are not opposite forces, but partners in progress, which is reflected in the way we defend strong governance, we manage our environmental impact, we support our people and communities and lead the responsible game. This commitment to progress shaped our approach in 2024, as a year of recalibration in which we continue to strengthen operations, operations, rekindle the impetus and ensure that our integrated resorts remain at the forefront of excellence, ”he concluded.

item.title: Seismos | Macau will have a monitoring station in national partnership
item.description:
The Secretary for Transport and Public Works, Raymond Tam, presented on Wednesday the report of the 2025 government lines for his tutelage, and said to the deputies that a seismo monitoring station will be created in partnership with interior authorities from China will be created.
The Macao government announced on Wednesday the creation, together with the interior authorities of China, of a seismic monitoring station, as part of the authorities' plans to reinforce disaster prevention. “The meteorological and seismic monitoring network will be optimized, and is foreseen, in collaboration with the competent services of the interior of China, the construction of a seismic monitoring station,” said the secretary for public works and transport, by presenting, in the Legislative Assembly (AL), the lines of government action (LAG) for the guardianship, for 2025. Raymond Tam will justified the new station with the intention of "increasing the capacity for analysis and evaluation in the scope of natural disasters." The space has realized in the direction of the Meteorological and Geophysical Services (SMG), will be located in Hengqin. "Macao's earthly area is small and population density is very high, so it is difficult to find space for the creation of monitoring stations and now with the favorable policies with Guangdong province, we have been able to build a joint monitoring station in the cooperation zone [deepened between Guangdong and Macau]," SMG director Leong Weng Kun said. The official noted that the space should contribute to "increasing prevention capacity and public knowledge about weather information." Agree Macao and Zhuhai signed the “comprehensive and deepening cooperation project in the context of meteorology, to reinforce the cooperation and sharing of meteorological detection equipment, computer programs and data sharing, according to a statement released by SMG at that time. Cooperation is also expected to reinforce the “joint prevention of weather catastrophs alert systems, promote scientific and technological research and the development of artificial intelligence applied to weather activity”. Macao is often affected between May and November by the passage of Tuffons, being July to September the period in which the highest incidence of tropical storms is recorded. This year, the territory is expected to be affected by between five to eight tropical storms, SMG announced in March. Light Metro | Secretary admits operating gaps The Secretary for Transport and Public Works Raymond Tam said on Wednesday that the light meter is still short of the expectations of the population. "I have to confess that the services of the Light Metro, namely the electronic payment services, are still short of the expectations of the population of Macao," he said, promising measures for the means of transport to improve "gradually". Environment | Policies planning will be studied this year The Secretary for Transport and Public Works Raymond Tam announced on Wednesday that this year will be "Study for the Next Planning of Environmental Protection", to support new "environmental policies based on a scientific and prospective view." Still in the area of ​​the environment, the ruler promised measures to achieve the national objective of the “double carbon goal”. As such, concrete emission reduction shares will be driven, including legislative elaboration for the control of emissions from non -road mobile sources, the slaughter of highly polluting vehicles, the improvement of the electric vehicle charging network, the exploitation of the potential application of photovoltaic energy in public spaces and the optimization of the energy structure ”, concluded the report. Housing | Government admits to review the whole policy With the reduction of demand for economic housing, the government admits to review all housing policy. "We are reviewing our policy at this time, taking into account the changes recorded. We will evaluate if there is a need to review the five housing class policy, but it is a subject that is still being studied," said Raymond Tam, secretary for transport and public works in the debate on governance lines for this year. The ruler said that "public housing policies will be reviewed and perfected, promoting the construction of social and economic housing and ensuring rational availability, in order to satisfy the housing needs of residents with different levels of income." item.title: Blackout | Normality resumed yesterday, it still causes because it
item.description:
The week has started atypically on the Iberian Peninsula. It was a few minutes from 11:30 am on Monday, when a widespread electricity failure paralyzed Portugal and Spain. Only near 23h the light returned to the Portuguese house, but the dropper
It was an apparent normal Monday, but this normality was dissipated late in the morning with the electricity failure that gradually led to communication failures and impossibility of using mobile data. Portugal and Spain were without electricity for too many hours on Monday, an unprecedented episode in terms of energy failures. In the case of Lisbon, the light began to fail a few minutes after 11:30 am, followed by the impossibility of communication via mobile data. Traffic in the center of the Portuguese capital became chaotic, without traffic lights in operation, generating some road accidents. Supermarkets, cafes and restaurants, with no possibility of maintaining normal operation and food properly refrigerated, closed doors. Many people, frightened by the possibility of staying several days without light, ran to supermarkets, sagging canned foods, water carboys, candles and batteries. In addition to the unusual constraints in people's daily lives, with the suddenly closed meter and congested transport, there were suspended flights and closed airports. The restoration of energy took place gradually throughout Monday, starting with the Center of Portugal. The circulation in the Lisbon Metropolitan (ML) was resumed at all at 08:38, Lisbon time, first in the blue and red lines at 08h, in yellow at 08:15 and green at 08:38. "The Lisbon Metropolitano had a vast team working yesterday evening [Monday] and today's dawn [Tuesday] to ensure the replacement of operating systems affected by the widespread energy failure yesterday," the ML said in a statement. Government words In a note issued by the Portuguese government in the early hours of yesterday morning, it was said that there were already “virtually all services, including the supply of energy, restored,” Presidential Minister António Leitão Amaro told Lusa. According to the minister, all 6.4 million customers had access to electricity in the early hours of Tuesday morning, except 800 who had faults not related to the blackout. Leitão Amaro also said that water supply is working throughout the country, with only a few pressure difficulties in "two or three municipalities" that will be "resolved quickly". Regarding transportation, the minister said that the "trains are working", and it is still necessary to stabilize some points of the operation, but due to the effects of 24 hours strike that took place on Monday. About airports, “are operational,” said Leitão Amaro, recognizing that in the case of Lisbon airport, which was the most affected by energy failure and should take two days [to this day] to have stabilized flows, although the systems are all operational. Normalized Schools and Health The Portuguese ruler also said that, in relation to schools, the orientation issued at dawn to all directors was to open and function normally, except for cases where there may be some specific security ratio. "The supply of fuels is normalized and did not record, at night, relevant occurrences of security or civil protection" in the country, advanced Leitão Amaro, stressing that the situation is also stabilized in health services. "Hospitals and health centers are in terms of supply and supply to function normally," he said. "Right now, what we can say is that [energy] systems are stabilized, both in transportation and consumers supply," said the presidency minister. In Spain there were also several embarrassment, especially at the level of transport. Pedro Sánchez, Spanish Prime Minister, said on Monday, quoted by Lusa, that this episode was unprecedented in the country. The ruler spoke to the country after the second meeting of Spain National Security Council. "All potential causes are analyzed without discarding any hypothesis," he added. Gigawatts loss The Spanish government leader revealed that, according to the technicians and experts of the Spanish power grid, 15 generation gigawatts "suddenly lost the system in just five seconds, something that had never happened." According to explained, to give a dimension of the event, 15 kilowatts of generation correspond to approximately looking for total electricity in the country at the time of blackout (12:33 in Spain, 11h33 in Lisbon). "What has caused this sudden disappearance of supply" is something that experts cannot yet explain, he added. In the early hours after the blackout, information began to circulate on a possible cyberathel who never confirmed. A few hours after the blackout, Ursula Von der Leyen, president of the European Commission, said on Linkedin's social network that he had spoken with the prime ministers Pedro Sánchez and Luís Montenegro about the monitoring of the case. “I reaffirmed that the European Commission has supported and monitored the situation with national and European authorities and together with our electricity coordination group. We will gather efforts and share information to help restore the electricity supply system, agreeing to maintain narrow contact,” reads one of the publications. Eduardo Prieto, head of operations at Spanish Red Electric, told the Associated Press that the situation was not preceded by something “exceptional and extraordinary”. One of the possible causes pointed to the blackout is a rare atmospheric phenomenon, referred to as “induced atmospheric vibration”, which may have originated “anomalous oscillations” in the high voltage lines of the Spanish energy network. "These oscillations have caused synchronization failures between electrical systems, leading to successive disturbances in interconnected European networks," the Portuguese Energy company Ren to BBC told Monday afternoon. But later Ren denied this information. Many issues Another causes may have been technical problems in the electric network itself. Onyema NDUKA, a full -sustainability professor of energy sustainability at the University of London, said electric networks are usually interconnected because the production centers that feed them are located far from cities. This means that a power cut in a part of the grid can "lead to a waterfall effect in other areas." "Ideally, redundancies are incorporated into the system, such as having several supply points, reserve generators located in different locations, wires and interconnected cables, etc.," he said. The solution is through energy companies to restore electricity to affected customers as soon as possible, but the procedure for doing so “has not yet been revealed,” added NDUKA. The Portuguese authorities, cited by the AP and the local media, have so far attributed the failure of energy to unspecified technical problems, originating outside the country, but mentioned that the investigation is still underway. The possibility of a cyberatoque is, for now, away. “Spain has mechanisms to deal with this kind of situations. Once again, I appeal to citizens to collaborate with all authorities and act responsibly and civilly, as we have always done,” wrote Pedro Sánchez on social networks. The Portuguese National Cyberrseness Center also stated in a statement that there is no evidence that the failure was caused by a computer attack. Speaking to Euronews, Taco Engelaar, Neara Director-General, a specialist in energy infrastructure, said the interconnectivity of national networks and their systems would mean that a failure or attack would have the same net result. "Such a widespread failure of the network is extremely unusual and can be caused by a number of factors: a physical failure on the network that provokes the power cut, a coordinated cybercar or a dramatic imbalance between demand and the supply that has made the network system exceeds the boundaries," he said. "If it is a system failure, then the interconnectivity between the different regional and national networks can lead to the large amount of power cuts we are watching today [Monday]," he added. "The same applies to a cybership - many of these systems are linked and sharing assets - to overthrow one can overthrow many," he said. With agencies

Hugo Schuchardt's interest in Luso-Asian Creole has been studied by Hugo Cardoso, a researcher and professor at the Faculty of Letters of the University of Lisbon (FLUL), a Creole specialist who developed investigation at the University of Macao. The academic recently led a lecture at the National Library in Lisbon over the linguist born in Gotha, Germany, in 1842 and died in Graz, Austria, in 1927, being considered one of the most important linguists of the late nineteenth and early twentieth century. The session was called “Hugo Schuchardt and the search for the Luso-Asian Creole”. Despite Schuchardt's interest on Macao's Creole, he did not publish any academic work on the subject, as he told HM Hugo Cardoso. "Schuchardt did not publish any work on Macau. However, when he covered his correspondence, it is clear that Macau was also on his radar, since he discusses the Macao Creole with several of his correspondents, including Vasconcelos milk and Gonçalves Viana," he said. After the German linguist, Hugo Cardoso highlights, “there were actually several people who leaned over Macau Creole, including Danilo Barreiros, José dos Santos Ferreira (Adé), Graciete Batalha, Ana Maria Amaro and, more recently, Prof. Raúl Gaião and Prof. Mário Pinharanda Nunes”. Also noteworthy is the study of Marie Arana-ward "about the Creole spoken by the descendants of Macanese in Hong Kong." For the professor at FLUL, pioneering in the study of the Creoles is an expression that rhymes with Schuchardt. The German linguist was "absolutely pioneering in this domain, not only in the study of the Luso-Sasitive Creole or even the Portuguese Lexical Base Creoles globally, but in the study of Creole languages ​​in general" and, for this reason, is "a larger figure in the history of linguistics." Hugo Cardoso also points out that "as regards the Portuguese lexical base creoles, before him, there had been some activity, especially by Adolfo Coelho, who, in 1881, had published" Romanesque or Neo-Latin dialects in Africa, Asia and America, "in which he was a caught in various Portuguese-based Creole." However, in this work, Adolfo Coelho refers only to three Luso-Asiatic Creole: “Ceylon's (at Sri Lanka), Malaca and Macau's-giving some examples that he could get from previous publications (such as Macau's Ta-Ss-Yang-Kuo magazine)”. The academic has no doubt that “Hugo Schuchardt was surely inspired by Rabbit's work, but his efforts to obtain primary data from many other Asian places greatly expanded cartography of the Luso-sinical Creole and resulted in the first published news and the first grammatical descriptions of many of them (such as Diu, Cananor, Mahé, Mangar, Mangar, Mangar etc.) ”. Future inspirations According to Hugo Cardoso, the German linguist left works that inspired future academics and many materials from the personal archive. "One effect of his work was to inspire other agents to develop similar work: there stands out the figure of Sebastião Rodolfo Dalgado, who led his own research and made his own publications about the Indo-Portuguese Creoles that Schuchardt had not approached, about Damão, Bombaim, Ceylon and Negapath." In the case of José de Leite Vasconcelos, who wrote the letter cited at the beginning of this text, "it also corresponded with Schuchardt and reveals, in his linguistic studies, the impact of Schuchardt's work." Asked by HM about the possible interconnections between the Creole of IUD, Batávia and Macao, Hugo Cardoso states that there are "continuities between the various Luso-Asian Creole, but also many differences." "The Batávia/Tugu Creole is the one that most resembles Creole de Macao, for example, at the Lexicon level. item.title: Electricity cut affects Portugal, Spain and parts of southern France
item.description: A flaw of electricity affected, at 11:33 (18h33 in Macao), Portugal, Spain and some areas of southern France. In the first moments, information and speculation about the cause of the blackout were disseminated, namely in relation to a possible large-scale cyberataque, a hypothesis that was not excluded in the first instance by the General Secretariat of Internal Administration. Until the closing of this issue, the cause was not yet clear, nor was there an estimate for the return of electricity, but Prime Minister Luís Montenegro said he had hope that the light supply would be resumed yesterday, according to Lisbon time (7 less for Macau). However, there were news in Portuguese media that pointed to the return of electricity in various parts of the country, as well as in Spain. The Expresso newspaper cited data collected by the operators of the electricity network in the Iberian peninsula that pointed to tension imbalances as an explanation for the "blackout" rather than a cyberatheck designed to affect energy infrastructures. Until the closing of this edition, the Portuguese government did not rule out any explanation for the incident. The e-nodes warned that the forecast of electricity replacement remained indefinite and could be prolonged, without advance an estimate. "Given the problems of the network that persist the forecast of energy replacement remains undefined and may be prolonged," said the operator of the electricity distribution network in mainland Portugal, in a statement. E-Redes reiterated that the supply of electricity in Portugal was being affected by upstream constraints of the distribution network, in the very high voltage network in Spain. According to REN - national power grid, yesterday's blackout may have been caused by abnormal temperature fluctuations in Spain. The news was advanced by the BBC, which mentions an atmospheric phenomenon. Pandemonium scenario The incident caused chaos in the country. At airports, check-ins became manuals and began to be announced on flights at first, but were eventually canceled. TAP has issued a statement to appeal to passengers so as not to go to airports, as operation is temporarily conditioned due to blackout. Rail traffic was also totally interrupted throughout the Iberian Peninsula. In hospitals, emergency generators and emergency services and surgeries have been prioritized to respond to urgent cases. In addition to the Emergency Meeting of the Council of Ministers, the National Operational Coordination Center, which is part of the entities in the context of protection and relief operations, gathered to follow the situation and adopt the necessary procedures due to the lack of energy in mainland Portugal. The telephone and computer systems of the National Institute of Emergency Medical was operating until the closing of this edition using generators and the fuel supply posts interrupted the services. On the other hand, the Águas de Portugal (ADP) group appealed to water consumption only for essential uses, “very moderate”, and said there were only “punctual failures”. Heard by Lusa regarding the widespread cutting of electricity and a possible water failure, the company's official source warned that there may be consumer constraints, although without advanced more concrete data. ADP, which brings together more than a dozen water suppliers on the continent, "appeals to the use of water for the essentials only." "ADP is following the situation in all companies," the source said. The company, he added, intends to ensure that essential services have water and recalled that reservoirs have water but it takes energy to transport it, and that even the buildings themselves need energy to get water to consumers taps.

item.title: LAG 2025 | Facilitated automatic passage from foreign visitors
item.description:
In the presentation of this year's security lines for security, Wong Sio Chak referred to the idea of ​​facilitating the entry into Macau to foreign visitors, with the creation of more automatic passage points
The Secretary for Security announced on Friday, plans to accelerate the border control of foreign visitors through the use of automatic electronic channels. During the presentation of the Governing Action Lines Report (LAG) to 2025 in the area of ​​security, Wong Sio Chak stated that the territory will extend the use of automatic passage points to foreign citizens without resident or work authorization. To facilitate “exterior exchanges”, authorities will expand autoservice equipment to the biometric data collection system, which will apply to all foreign visitors, the leader explained. To the deputies at the Legislative Assembly, the secretary added that the government will continue to optimize iris recognition technology in border controls and to study its extension to non-residents this year. "We are also studying ways to widen the number of users eligible for automatic passage channels, allowing more foreign tourists to benefit from faster immigration processes and more fluid circulation in the large bay," Wong said. Speech and company In his speech, the secretary stated that "regarding the creation of a higher level of opening abroad, the input and output services will continue to be optimized and the facilitation measures of the border passage, to ensure a safe, effective, efficient and comfortable passage." Thus, "with a view to promoting the exchange with the outside, the automatic passage channels will also have foreigners, so that they deal with the input and exit inspection formalities through these channels." According to official data, Macau received, in 2024, 34.9 million visitors, 23.8 percent than the previous year, but only 2.42 million were international tourists. In October last year, the Chinese Foreign Ministry extended the Portuguese visa exemption policy, thus inserting Portugal into a list that already covered another 16 European countries. The measure, which allows the Portuguese to stay in China for tourism, business or traffic for a maximum of 15 days, in force at least until December 31, 2025. In the same month, Continental China had announced the expansion, from 90 to 180 days, from the permanence period for foreign residents of Macao on multiple entries in the country. The measure includes permanent and non-permanent foreign residents of Macao that move “to the interior of China for short-term tourism, trade, visit to family members, visits and other activities”. From July, the Chinese National Immigration Administration (NIA) had already allowed foreign permanent residents from Macao and Hong Kong to request authorization to enter the interior of China, valid for a maximum of five years. The measure covers members of the Portuguese community who are permanent residents in Macao and, until then, were required to ask for a visa to travel to the other side of the border.

item.title: April 25 | The Revolution of Cloves seen by the Chinese press
item.description:
The fall of the Estado Novo on April 25, 1974 was reported by the Chinese language press in Macao. Community concerns were revealed, namely about the permanence of the Noble Governor of Carvalho for stability and good business environment, as well as the “status quo” of Macau in the context of decolonization
The echoes of the April 25, 1974 revolution were late in Macao, but this did not mean absence of news in the following days, including the local Chinese press. HM consulted some of the news of the Chinese newspapers of the time over this period, translated to Portuguese by employees of the Press Censorship Commission (CCI), the public body that worked in Macao during the Portuguese dictatorial regime. This material is today to keep the Historical-Diplomatic Archive of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in Lisbon. Its reading allows not only to realize some of the events that succeeded the revolution, but also the perceptions and concerns that the Chinese community had on what happened in Portugal. The Chinese wanted to maintain the stability and continuation of business. And if the Noble Governor of Carvalho, in power since 1966, was, for many, connoted with the fascist regime, and therefore had to leave, the truth is that many wanted their permanence to ensure social peace. As read in the book “Macao in the years of the 1974-1979 Portuguese Revolution”, by Garcia Leandro, former Portuguese governor, “Macao's Chinese sought, above all, stability to be able to continue quietly to their business, and did not want conflicts or misunderstandings with Beijing or Canton”. Administration was “weak, very badly supported technically and to be easily corrupted”, so there were “strong reasons for the local MFA [Movement of the Forces] and the CDM [Macao Democratic Center] want to change, especially for the permanent corruption and the sense of excessive weakness of the Portuguese administration, which seemed nothing to decide without preview of Chinese representatives”. MFA explanations Shortly after April 25, Macau was visited by two MFA representatives, namely Major Rebelo Gonçalves and Garcia Leandro himself, to explain the revolution and objectives of MFA to Portugal and the colonies, not just to the population but to journalists. One of the meetings, with local journalists, was described by the Tai Chung newspaper on May 6, 1974. "Rebelo Gonçalves received the reporters and narrated them in detail the coup d'état. On the day (of the event), the song" Who sends the people "served as a sign of action." The CCI translator attributed to the song “Grandola, Vila Morena”, by José Afonso, chosen to be the second password of the revolution on the radio, the name “Who Mandates is the people”, in reference to the verse of the letter “The people are the one who orders the most”. The news continued, quoting Rebelo Gonçalves: he said "that the coup d'état was the desire of the people, so it achieved success in the period of one day." Support to Nobre de Carvalho Fallen the regime in Lisbon, and exiled Marcelo Caetano, the issue of the Governor's permanence at the head of the destinations of Macao was quickly asked. However, Nobre de Carvalho received popular support to continue, as described from the news of the newspaper SI Man, October 4, 1974. "Portugal does not intend to modify Macau's status quo, a Portuguese delegate told Chinese traders. This delegate manifests himself pleased with the governor's re-competition campaign, promoted by several social sectors. However, Mr. General Nobre de Carvalho had already requested the dismissal of the position of governor for health reasons." In addition, a group was created “for the collection of signatures in favor of the renewal of Mr. General Nobre de Carvalho in the position of Governor of Macao”, which were handed over to Garcia Leandro, still as MFA official. This one received "two boxes containing signatures-cadenic books." "Opinions of entities of industrial and commercial circles were transmitted, hoping that the governor can remain in Macao, which given his wide experiences and knowledge of conditionalisms, can overcome the difficulties resulting from the economic decline that now happens around the world." But if the desire for many was the continuity of Nobre Carvalho, the departure of many civil servants began to be connoted with the change of regime. As referred to in the news of the Jornal Si Man, May 11, 1974. “The head of health and assistance services, Dr. António Joaquim Paulino, will return on the 27th of this month to mainland Portugal, which is reported to fall from Marcelo Caetano's government. The competent authorities refused to comment on the departure of Dr. Paulino.” The newspaper also added: "However, news from Fidente Fonte reported: It is believed that the unappropriate return to Lisbon of Dr. Paulino, whose service commission in this province has not yet ended, is related to the coup (continental). Still in early May, there were still many questions unanswered, and the newspaper SI Man associated the departure of Vasco Rocha Vieira from the territory, at the time of the military command of the Military Command, with the absence of explanations for the political situation. “A fortnight has passed a fortnight after the coup d'état in Portugal has been fully clarified that the political situation of that country was fully clarified. Although Macau is little affected by the event, the chief of staff of Portuguese troops parked in Macao, Major Rocha Vieira yesterday, which led many people to conjecture and suspect the junta of national salvation. Portuguese government had already started acting in Macau. ” Ho Yin's explanations Tai Chung Pou newspaper reported, on May 22, 1974, that "some Portuguese declared in Hong Kong that they were unhappy with the measures taken by the governor and the government of Macao", followed "for the metropolis to ask for the granting of freedom to the Portuguese of Macao." Ho Yin, a striking entrepreneur and figure of the local Chinese community, who dialogue directly with the governor representing the Chinese authorities, explained in a session with “foreign reporters, as well as those of Hong Kong and Macau” about April events. These “visited Mr. Ho Yin, asking him for opinion,” describes Tai Chung Pou. And once again, Ho Yin appealed his spirits, noting that noble Carvalho had all the legitimacy to continue as governor. "Since the Portuguese coup d'état, registered on April 25, Macau, given its special circumstances, has been felt, to date, very quiet, not undergoing any change. Mr. Governor, General Nobre de Carvalho, who has been in Macao for over seven years, has deep knowledge of the conditions of this city, having resolved many matters through conversations and wrowning great efforts to this city," Ho Yin told the journalists, according to the journalists, according to the journalists. newspaper report. At the same meeting, the possibility of dissolution of the Legislative Assembly, proposal of the CDM, was questioned. But Ho Yin pushed any sudden political change. “It is known that the Macao Democratic Center, consisting of some Portuguese, requested the dissolution of the Legislative Assembly and the Municipal Council [Leal Senate], as well as the remodeling of some public services. Some inhabitants thought that the assertions of that center would affect the social order, but they came to know that they were only the opinion of a small number of Portuguese, when the city is still the city quiet, after a few days. ” The newspaper adds that Nobre de Carvalho publicly explained "that Al would not be dissolved, so the population of Macao became carefree and entrusted in the prosperity of this city." In addition, “tourists from Hong Kong, as well as abroad, also think Macao is quiet and is not affected at all,” read in Tai Chung Pou. The Seng Pou newspaper also reported this meeting between Ho Yin and journalists, in which the Chinese community leader commented on the benefits of a democratic regime. "Given their peculiar circumstances and due to the fact that the Portuguese and Chinese respected themselves and live in peace for a long time, Macau has not suffered any repercussions resulting from that Portuguese coup," Ho Yin said, stressing that "as for the freedom of the word, it has always existed in Macau." However, the entrepreneur appealed to some containment in the political criticism made. "Democracy and freedom that are now verified in mainland Portugal are happiness to the Portuguese people. And the Portuguese and Chinese have lived in the past in peace, and it is expected to continue to succeed in the future. In the then, criticism of private people or public offices should be founded, since any thoughtless attack would make complications to the question, and affect its tranquility and prosperity." Macau without decolonization One of the questions emanating from April 25, 1974 was the most urgent process of decolonization in the so -called Portuguese Africa where the colonial war was due since 1961. First of all, the authorities clarified that Macau would be left out of this process, because “the Popular Republic of China was careful that in 1972, in the UN decolonization committee, to make it very clear that the future of these two European possessions [Macao and Hong and Hong Kong] would not be part of the agenda of the activities of that body, being the subject treated bilaterally, ”reads in the book of Garcia Leandro. In the September 11, 1974 edition, the Tai Chung Pou newspaper wrote that “the head of the Macao Government Office, Lieutenant Colonel Henrique Manuel Lages Ribeiro, pointed out that news emanating from the news agency Reuters had been misunderstood, and that Macau has a peculiar position”, because “the way to solve his future is different from other Portuguese overseas territories.” The words of Almeida Santos are cited, the Portuguese Minister of Interterritorial Coordination, who said “that it would be allowed to all Portuguese overseas territories to choose the form of independence as a means to solve their own problem, with the exception of Macao that, being a very special territory, requires a special way to solve your problem”. In the translation of this news, there is also a note written by the editor itself: "This means that there is no problem of independence in Macau." The visits by Rebelo Gonçalves and Garcia Leandro Macau took place in “Finals of May, early June 1974. Almeida Santos was in Macao in September of this year and it was at this stage that Garcia Leandro was chosen governor of Macao, taking office on 13 November of this year.

item.title: Administration | Ng wai han leaves from SAFP to drive dicj
item.description:
With the passage of Adriano Marques Ho to customs services, the direction of inspection and coordination of games began to be led interim by its sub-director Lio Chi Chong. The secretary for the economy and finances yesterday appointed NG Wai Han, the first woman at the head of the regulating entity of the Macao game
The Game Inspection and Coordination Directorate (DICJ) has a new director. An order signed by the secretary for the economy and finance, Tai Kin IP, published yesterday in the official bulletin, names NG Wai Han as director of DICJ for a one year period. The NG Wai Han Service Commission began just yesterday with the publication of the order. It is recalled that the position had been vacant since Adriano Marques Ho was taken to the post of Customs Director General in December, during the reformulation of the holders of high public positions with the inauguration of the new Sam Hou Fai government. To the place of Adriano Marques Ho, who has directed Dicj since June 2020, the new executive appointed sub-director Lio Chi Chong. Ng Wai Han became the first woman in the leadership of the DICJ, after the exercise of Manuel das Neves, Paulo Martins Chan and Adriano Marques Ho. The rise of the former director of administration and civil service services to the top of the DICJ hierarchy marks a difference in the profile of leaders, which have so far come from the area of ​​security forces. WORK AND ADMINISTRATION The Secretary for Economics and Finance states that “NG Wai Han has professional competence and aptitude to exercise the position of director of the Directorate of Inspection and Game Coordination, which is demonstrated by Curriculum Vitae”. The new leader of the game regulatory entity in the territory is a law degree from the University of Sun Yat-Sen, where he also made a master's degree in Criminal Law. In 1999, he entered the civil service, to the position of Higher Technique (legal area) of the Directorate of Services for Labor Affairs (DSAL), where it remained until 2013. Between 2013 and 2016, headed the Divisions of Study of the Department of Studies and Informatics and Labor Rights Control of the Department of Labor Inspection. In May 2016, he began to lead the Labor Inspection Department and a year later was appointed subdirect, substitute of DSAL, and subdirecting until 2020, when it moved to the administration and civil service services after two decades in DSal. Between June 2020 and August 2023, Ng Wai Han was the subdirect of SAFP and a month later went to the SAFP, a position he held until yesterday.

item.title: Tour Guides | Government reduces fines due to the crisis
item.description: Tour guides who work without proper identification must be paid lower fines. This is the will of the government taking into account the new scenario to reduce the number of excursions. The matter was discussed in another meeting of the Permanent Commission of the Legislative Assembly (AL) that analyzes, in the specialty, the proposal of the activity of travel agencies and profession of tourist guide. At the meeting, which took place on Tuesday, Deputy Chan Chak Mo, who chairs the commission, explained that the government determined a significant reduction in the amount of the fine in case of offense after hearing the sector's opinions. At question is the fact that the content of the bill was prepared before the pandemic, but the Covid-19 years have changed the tourism landscape, with fewer excursions in Macao, which led to a crisis scenario. Thus, if the initial fine proposal focused between 10 and 20 thousand patacas, the new proposal goes down the penalty for values ​​between 2 and 10 thousand patacas. In addition, at Tuesday's meeting, it was also referred to by government representatives that a warning mechanism will be created for guides who make the first offense, namely when they do not show the licensing card of the activity.

item.title: Childhood Subsidy | Says it is an incentive for birth
item.description:
Babies born this year will receive, in the first three years of life, a total of 87 thousand patacas in the context of the concession of the new childhood allowance. Hon Wai, president of the Institute of Social Action, defended yesterday that this new measure can promote the growth of the birth rate
Preparations are underway for the creation of a new support for families who wish to have more children, and which has been announced in the last lines of governing action (LAG) for this year. As stated yesterday Hon Wai, president of the Institute of Social Action (IAS), in the Macao Forum Morning Program, of the Chinese channel of Radio Macau, this measure can even contribute to an increase in birth. "We hope that this subsidy can encourage local families to have children. Of course to increase birth we have to consider various aspects, and with this allowance we hope to be able to give some financial support to alleviate the economic pressure of Macao families. We launched the childhood assistance allowance, and to increase the birth system," he said. In the case of a child born this year, the childhood allowance implies the government's attribution of a total of 87,000 patacas in three years, taking into account the monthly amount of 1,500 patacas. The 87,000 patacas that children born this year will receive concern childhood allowance added to birth and pecuniary checks. The recipients of the childhood assistance allowance have to be permanent residents, including babies born in 2022. As mentioned, it is a new support that reaches 15,000 babies and children. At this stage, IAS works in the elaboration of the administrative regulation, as the measure should come into force at the time of summer. The monthly amount serves mainly to relieve the burden of families with essential expenses such as the purchase of diapers, milk powder or food, having been calculated based on the data provided by the Consumer Council. "We are based on the Consumer Council in view of the average prices of baby goods, so we estimate weekly costs of around 900 to 1,300 patacas," he said on the program. After a preliminary analysis, the government has decided that registrations will be made through the Macao Single Account platform, as it has the essential information of parents and children. Hon Wai also pointed out that information about the basic structure of this support is already defined and can be available in the single account. "We foresee that thousands of parents are covered by the program and can request the subsidy at the same time, so IAS needs to ensure the platform's operation and ensure questions such as cybersecurity," he said. Study on day care centers In the same program, IAS Early Childhood Work Chief Team, Wong In Leng confirmed that IAS will study the search for the demand for day care centers and facilities available for children under two years. Wong in Leng also assured that in addition to being reinforced training for professionals who take over children, an external assessment will be made at the institutional level in order to ensure the quality of day care centers. The official concluded that IAS annually assigns more than 240 million patacas to subsidized day care centers, and each vacancy is supported by 34 thousand patacas. Nurseries offer more than 900 free places.

item.title: Elderly | Recognizes difficulties in social companies
item.description: The Institute of Social Action (IAS) recognizes that the new trade environment has negatively affected the only two social companies that have among its functions to hire elderly workers. The current scenario was outlined in response to an interpetement of Deputy Lei Chan U, linked to the Federation of Macao Workers' Associations (Faom). "Currently, the two social companies for the elderly who came into operation are from the area of ​​restoration, providing 16 full -time and six part -time vacancies for the elderly," he was explained. "The two projects of social company went into operation during the pandemic period. Due to the impact of the pandemic and market environment, the daily operation and development of social companies were relatively affected. After the pandemic, society and the economy of Macao gradually recovered, however, in the face of the constant change of the business environment of Macau, the operation of companies, including the elderly companies, faced many challenges and pressures." Despite various strategies to relaunch the business, such as promotions or extending opening hours, IAS President Hon Wai admits that the situation has known few improvements. However, IAS indicates that the future deceiving plan of action for support services to the elderly, which is expected to take effect next year, should have more measures to encourage the hiring of the elderly.

item.title: Local Accommodation | Lo Choi in recognizes challenges, but asks study
item.description:
The deputy linked to the community of Jiangmen points out that, despite the ban on local accommodation in Macau, there are ads everywhere and that a simple search on the internet has offers for almost all tastes
Lo Choi in wants to know if the new government has plans to study the viability of local accommodation in Macao. The issue is part of an interpellation written by the deputy linked to the Jiangmen community, released on the Legislative Assembly portal. According to Lo Choi In, illegal pensions are currently found in a mixed regime, in which although they are prohibited, they have not been criminalized, which has made them present in Macao. In addition, it indicates, the increase in the number of a new type of tourists in the interior of China has also contributed to the search for these spaces to continue to grow. In this context, where the deputy asks if it would not be better to study the legal viability of local accommodation, since it becomes increasingly impossible to combat the phenomenon. "The law of the prohibition of illegal accommodation of accommodation did not criminalize the offer of local accommodation in Macao. The legislative intention went to leave margin so that in the future it could advance to legalization," said the deputy, who voted in favor of the proposal. "However, the law imposes an administrative sanction for the offer of local accommodation of 800 thousand patacas, which also reflects the concern of the community with illegal accommodation," he acknowledged. "Does competent services can take the initiative to join some academic institutions, community interest groups and study the viability of local accommodation to examine and explore the advantages and disadvantages to Macao?" Ahead of all Lo Choi also considers that despite the problems of illegal accommodation this is an increasingly present reality The deputy mentions that in recent times her cabinet has increasingly received complaints from residents, because in the buildings where they live, especially in the high times of tourism, it is increasingly frequent to see tourists from the interior of China to enter and get out of travel luggage. There were also complaints about tourists who address residents to ask where local accommodation is, without being aware that it is an illegal practice. In addition to the increase in the number of complaints received, LO indicates that online search on general search engines or accommodation offer show several illegal housing available in Macao. Given this growth, and given the illegalization, the deputy asks the government to intensify efforts to combat the phenomenon and to make a campaign for tourists to realize the risks they take, in case of accidents, for being these accommodation. Lo Choi In also asks the government to make the mechanisms more effective for denouncing illegal housing, especially through online media, which it considers to be the most effective.

item.title: Artificial Intelligence on Sex in Macau
item.description: I had the experience of asking the most popular artificial intelligence platform that themes about sex, sexuality and gender would make sense to discuss in Macau. The answer brought three proposals that, although not very surprising, I found it interesting. Of course the platform used some creative and intellectual freedom - which I didn't ask for - to invent sources, quotes and points of view. Basically, he went to seek what is already known about Taiwan and Hong Kong, about the growing opening to LGBTQI+themes, and tried to make parallels with Macao. He mentioned the rainbow of Macau/澳門彩虹/Rainbow of Macau as the most active association in defending LGBTQI+ rights in the territory, and even invented interviews with its founder, with fictional quotes. The first proposal that artificial intelligence suggested is about Macao young people and their opening to non-binary and plural gender identities as a way of navigating western and oriental cultural identities, and monitoring generational changes. Worldwide we have seen an emancipation movement in this area, with many young people to discuss these issues openly. If in some countries institutions and policies follow these changes (and in others until retreat), in Macao the pit may be higher, taking into account its geographical situation. I went looking for studies that deepened the subject and found one who asked young people from Macau between 18 and 25 years old. The authors have analyzed how adherence to polyculturalism, the idea that crops are interconnected and influence each other, associated with lower levels of sexual prejudice, including negative attitudes towards LGBTQ+people. The study suggests that the cultural diversity of Macao, and the belief that cultures mingle, can create a predisposition to also accept sexual diversity. But I would say that it is still necessary to explore more about these issues, listening to real testimonies about the experiences of young people living in Macao. The second proposal - which I have mentioned here without account - has to do with the lack of accessible, inclusive and focused sex education, promoting more knowledge and pleasure in Macao and worldwide. If a few months ago I gave the example of Hong Kong, where it was suggested to play Badminton as a way to manage sexual abstinence, I would say that Macau is not much more open to talking about sex than that. This lack of discussion creates a series of complications that, due to the absence of data in the region, do not even know the true dimension of the problem. The absence of comprehensive and inclusive sex education increases the risk of sexual violence, discrimination and propagation of sexually transmitted infections. The third proposal surprised me, because it is a theme in which I rarely think: the growth of LGBTQia+ tourism in Asia and the opportunity that Macau has to bet on this niche. Since the hotel industry is the pillar of the economy of Macao, it would make sense to embrace this opportunity, as they have already made Thailand and Taiwan, creating LGBTQIA+spaces, or with specific events, such as Pride Month celebrations. According to some data produced online, this type of tourism is profitable and growing. Artificial intelligence even has interesting ideas, although something generic. But I confess that I was pleased to realize that the algorithm is in tune to defend the rights of sexual minorities and has an inclusive discourse. It becomes dangerous, however, when it begins to invent data and information just so that the argument sounds good. Still, in general, it can be a useful tool for discussing these issues without judgment. As the platform itself says, it has the potential to “combat myths, spread ethical concepts and include perspectives of marginalized groups, democratizing access to more complete and positive sex education.” In this suggestion of content creation, it seemed aligned with these values. If you will ever replace the work of people like me, who write on these topics, or the work of sexual educators… maybe it's too early to draw conclusions. Sensitive and thinking people still have a lot to contribute.

item.title: Saint Valentine's Day in the Czech Republic
item.description: In Macao, many people know that May 1st is Labor Day and is an official holiday. The same takes place in mainland China, marking May 1st the beginning of a long holiday. However, few know that in the Republic checked May 1st is the "Day of St. Valentine". On Valentine's Day, Czech lovers follow tradition and kiss under the cherry trees, singing songs to love. And the kiss why? According to Czech folklore, if a girl is not kissed under a cherry tree on St. Valentine's day, she will "wither" next year, losing "youth and charm." Therefore, a kiss means "protection and blessings." And what is “protection in love”? In mid -2015, Sean Lau, the winner of the Hong Kong's best actor's best actor award for his work in the movie “Overheard 3”, presented the “Space Nave Theory”. He used a simple phrase to show how his wife Amy Kwok protected him: “When I enter a spaceship and travel anywhere in the universe, you always find a way to bring me back to Earth safely.” The meaning of this phrase is simple and clear. If you are where you are, face what to face, you always bring me back safely. You are always by my side, making me be loved, hot, happy and in peace. Apart from the “spacecraft theory”, there is another sean Lau phrase that is part of the “passionate quotes for my wife”: "One day you no longer want to love love, you just want someone who doesn't leave you." Does true love require two people to stay together? In March 2025, news was released in Taiwan, China, saying that a woman had published an online article, where she said she had a boyfriend six years ago, but eventually found out that he was getting married to another. And this happened because her boyfriend loved her so much and didn't want her to go through the suffering caused by her relationship with her mother-in-law, so she decided to marry a woman from whom her parents liked, but he didn't like and assured his girlfriend that his "relationship" would not be affected. After marrying another woman, she would date forever with her beloved. Love implies "protection and blessings." Is it in favor of the “spacecraft theory” or “Nora/mother -in -law theory”? What are "blessings"? In Taiwan, China, the host of the television program “Yu Meiren”, (Yu Yunjie) had no contact with her in -laws for a long time. Once went to court due to a disagreement between mother and husband. Finally, the judge stated that his 16 -year marriage had come to an end. Later, Yu Meiren has lost a lot of weight, but now it is more beautiful than before and at his disposal has changed. She stated: "The French believe that in love we should accept those who come and we should not retain those who want to leave. 'When love happens, we must be ourselves, follow our hearts and act without schemes. When love is over, we must respect the other and not try to arrest or force it, which means that" letting out is the best of blessings. " Do you agree with the phrase “letting go is the best of blessings, the blessing is the best relief”? Hong Kong Cine Cine Cine Cenilia Cheung once expressed some disappointment after the divorce: "In love there is only one thing that can hurt us, it is the unwillingness. When we cannot live with ourselves, we inflicted pain." Perhaps that “protection and blessings” have different meanings for each person, but for me, "I have to say this only once. After all these years, I still love you." item.title: Ka Hó | “Hold on to Hope” gallery welcomes “our time zone”
item.description: The “Hold on To Hope” gallery, managed by the Macao Toxicode Rehabilitation Association (ArtM) at the settlement of Ka-Hó, in Coloane, has a new show, entitled “Our Time Zone-Collective Art Exhibition and Curative Calligraphy” with works by artists Kinki Wong and Belinda Chim. The exhibition is organized by the Macau Hope Painting Association and, according to words by Kinki Wong, who collaborates not only as an artist, but also as a curator, "was born of the idea that everyone experiences moments of ups and downs, uncertainty and confusion." Thus, for the artist, “Our Time Zone”, focused on artwork and handwriting, intends to “use sensory interaction to express art theories of art therapy, fostering a different interaction between art, culture and exposure”. Keeping in mind that “art reflects the body”, “Our Time Zone” promotes “the awareness of the local community for mental health” in order to “understand one's own body through art therapy”. Kinki Wong is a native of Macau and has been working as an expressive art therapist, having a master's degree in this area and specialization in Psychology from European Graduate School in Switzerland. Already Belinda Chim has done western handwriting since he went to Australia to study design. Having over ten years of experience in this art, Belinda stands out in the creation of works with animal themes, using expressive lines within Western handwriting. The artist has already held exhibitions and face -to -face courses in Hong Kong, Japan and Malaysia, having taught more than four thousand people in the area of ​​handwriting. The show can be visited until May 25th.
