item.title: Effective | Camilo Castelo Branco remembered today at Ipor
item.description:
Today a session of the Reading Club of the Association of Friends of the Book that will focus not only on the work “Fanny Owen”, by Agustina Bessa-Luís, but also in celebrating the 200th anniversary of the birth of Portuguese writer Camilo Castelo Branco. From 6.30 pm it's time to remember your life and written with interventions by Pedro d'Alme, Wang Suo Ying and Shee Vá
This year is the 200th anniversary of the birth of Portuguese writer Camilo Castelo Branco, a date that is now remembered at the Portuguese Institute of the East (IPOR) through a session of the Reading Club of the Association of Friends of the Book, held at the Camilo Pessanha Library in IPOR, from 18:30. According to a note from IPOR, the session addresses the work “Fanny Owen”, by Portuguese writer Agustina Bessa-Luís, being the motto to remember Camilo Castelo Branco, one of the authors of election of Bessa-Luís, since the work is inspired by the writer's personal life. Thus, today's session “tries to understand the writer”, bringing together Pedro d 'Alte, who will speak of his experience in approaching the work of Camilo Castelo Branco with the Chinese students. This will be assisted by Wang Suo Ying, who translated to Chinese some of Camilo's best -known works such as "Love of Perdition" and "The Fall of an Angel." Shee goes, doctor and author, also participates in today's session, trying to “understand man [Camilo Castelo Branco] through his biographers and admirers such as Agustina Bessa-Luís, Manuel de Oliveira and Mário Claudio”. To perceive the taste of Agustina Bessa-Luís for Camilo's writing, Ipor quotes his words: "Camilo is manipulative, his frivolity is but attempt to hide his weaknesses." The northern writer also said that "Camilo was an insurrect, with mud to the bones and two grammar books instead of lungs." Bohemian life The choice of the work “Fanny Owen” for this session does not appear by chance, since Agustina was inspired by Camilo's life story, when she fell in love with Ana Placido when she was married, a case that led to the arrest of both at a time when adultery was considered a crime in the nineteenth century. Later, the two would be acquitted, marrying and having children. “Fanny Owen” is thus based on these true facts that occurred in the midst of the nineteenth-century port intellectual and bohemian environment, where Camilo Castelo Branco's life story ends on the way of one of the book's characters, a young man, son of an English officer who is involved in the love that will only bring her problems and misfortunes. According to Ipor's note, Camilo Castelo Branco “is a larger author of the Portuguese language”, with a work “extensive that encompasses the soap opera, the romance, the chronicle, the leaflet, the poetry, the tale and the theater”. Moreover, "describes the society of the time like no one else using sarcasm and irony for what has created enmities, but also capable of acts of great generosity." Camilo Castelo Branco “lived a life of romance transporting with it frustration and huge complexity,” says Ipor. Camilo Castelo Branco was, besides novelist, chronicler, critic, playwright and translator. Received from King D. Luís the title of Viscount of Correia Botelho. Having been orphaned by parents as a child, he left Lisbon to live in Vila Real with an aunt, having married at 16. He studied medicine in Porto, but never finished the course, having definitely done his life from the lyrics. After the controversy surrounding the loving case with Ana Plácido, the two are together to the death of this, for suicide, since blindness made it impossible to continue writing.

item.title: MGM Resorts International warns bets in Japan and Thailand
item.description: A Casinos operator in Macau said yesterday that the opening of casinos in Japan and the potential legalization of the game in Thailand will increase competition with regard to Asian gamblers. The director for the global development of the US company MGM Resorts International, which operates two casinos in Macao, said the new game concessions accelerated the transition from a model based on major gamblers to “a more diverse tourism and entertainment economy”. The six Macao game operators signed 10-year concession agreements in December 2022, committing to invest 108.7 billion in tourism and the diversification of the economy. “The reinforcement of cultural attractions, from entertainment to families (…) helped attract more vast demographics than traditional gamblers,” said Ed Bowers. But the executive warned that "competition is intensifying in Asian markets, particularly with Japan and potentially Thailand." MGM started on April 24 with the construction of the first integrated venture with a Japan casino in Osaka, scheduled for 2030. The Thailand government presented a proposal to legalize the game. "This is excellent news for staff of the development of casinos like me," said Bowers, who recalled that Thailand "already benefits from a strong tourist infrastructure." But the discussion of the proposal in Parliament was postponed in early April, "probably due to the increase in political opposition" to the idea, admitted the executive. Other bets Bowers spoke during the Global Gaming Expo Asia, the largest event in the game industry held in Macau, which will take place until Friday. In another session of the same event, experts argued that, given the greater regional competition, the bet on game -related attractions, such as concerts, themed parks and gastronomy can bring more people to the casinos. “We built all this to support our casino, the casino is our financial engine,” said Wade Howk, director of operations at Inspire Entertainment Resort, an integrated resort in South Korea, with an exclusive casino for foreigners. The session focused on the diversification of the economy of Macao, where taxes on casinos represented 88.4 percent of the region's current current revenues in the first three months of the year. But the authorities intend that the sector not related to the game represent 60 percent of Macao Gross Domestic Product by 2028. As an example, Wade Howk stressed that Inspire Entertainment built a 15,000 -seat entertainment space, the only multipurpose cultural arena in South Korea to increase the number of visitors. "We are seeing huge results with this now, and then we built a covered water park ... just to make sure we could boost traffic to support the entire property, ... and that it could be used to support the casino," Howk explained. Jeffrey Kiang, an investment group analyst CSSA, stressed that game -related components should “create synergies and complement the business” of casinos. Kiang has observed an increase in the number of concerts held in Macao in the last two years and said that the casino operators carefully select events or artists who attract gamblers.

item.title: AMCM | Mobile transactions go up in the 1st quarter
item.description: Data from the Macao Monetary and Currency Authority (AMCM) show that in the first three months of the year increased the number of mobile payment transactions in Macau as well as its value. Thus, the number of transactions of this type was 90.4 million, an increase of 11.6 percent compared to the first trimester of 2024. In addition, the value of these mobile payments was 7.9 billion patacas, plus 8.7 percent over the same period last year. Until late March this year, a total of 108,749 devices and units, including “QR code” supports, accepted mobile payments. AMCM data also show that in the use of credit cards there was also an increase in the number of transactions, totaling 11.8 million, an increase of 9.7 percent compared to the first quarter of 2024. In addition, the number of transactions made with debit cards was 1.2 million, with a total value of transactions of 464.9 million patacas. It should be noted that these values ​​for the use of debit cards do not include cash surveys in atm boxes.

item.title: Land | Government makes evictions at Av. De Sidónio Pais
item.description: The government yesterday carried out an action of eviction and cleaning of a land located on Avenida de Sidónio Pais. The space, with an area of ​​about 121 square meters, thus moved to the government's power, since it was being occupied illegally. According to a note from the Directorate of Soil Services and Urban Construction (DSSCU), “the recovered terrain was paved and, on site, unauthorized works were noticeable, namely a clandestine construction composed of a metallic gate, brick walls and concrete cover, as well as stairs, flower beds and sealing wall”. DSCCU explains that it had already carried out all the usual procedures for the eviction of the land, "ordering the illegal occupant to vacate the same and reveal it to the government of MSAR within the stipulated time." item.title: Health | Services warn of “more active” chickenpox viruses
item.description:
The government yesterday launched an alert to the increase of costumes of chickenpox in Macao. Since the beginning of the year, authorities have reported 195 cases of infection, almost double the same period of 2024. About three quarters of infections are contracted by children
Macao's varicella virus is becoming more active, health services have indicated yesterday, appealing to parents, educational institutions, and day care centers to be aware of symptoms and adopt a preventive stance. According to data on communicable declaration diseases, authorities found that last week there was a “trend to increase the number of varicella cases, with the weekly average of 12 cases from April 6 to rise to 23 last week”. The body led by Alvis Lo points out that "this number is higher than that of last year's same -year period (10 cases)." Authorities also account for a case of collective chickenpox infection that was recently detected at Pui Ching Secondary School, affecting a total of 21 students. From May 1, students "had symptoms of rash and small bubbles on the head, face, limbs, back and chest, having undergone medical treatment." Authorities add that there were no serious complications and that "most patients were vaccinated with a dose of chickenpox." From the beginning Between January 1 and May 6 this year, 195 cases of chickenpox were recorded in Macao, a number that almost doubled infections during last year's same year, when 105 cases were registered. About three quarters of cases concern children, most ages between 8 and 17 years old, representing 65.1 percent of the total, while people aged 7 or under or less represent only 6.1 percent of the total. Health services highlight that since the beginning of the year there has been no record of serious or deadly cases. Authorities add that part of the inoculated population against the chickenpox is still likely to be affected by what health professionals call disruptive infection. However, "symptoms are usually slight and atypical, with fewer bubbles and the duration of the disease is relatively short." According to the government, the cases of chickenpox at Pui Ching secondary school are disruptive infections.

item.title: Francis Lui says that hotel scarcity threatens Macau's competitiveness
item.description: The leader of one of six casino operators in Macau warned yesterday that the shortage of hotel rooms could threaten the city's international competitiveness as a tourist destination. Galaxy Entertainment Group president Francis Lui Yiu Tung said that "the issue of hotel rooms should also be addressed," as Macao casinos focus on events and middle -class gamblers. Francis Lui recalled that Las Vegas received 42.5 million visitors in 2019, before the pandemic began, and that currently has "over 155,000 hotel rooms." "This is more than three times higher than Macao," lamented the businessman, although the city received more than 34.9 million tourists last year. And the number of hotel rooms available in Macau has been decreasing. According to official data, Macao's hotels and pensions had, at the end of March 2025, with 44,000 rooms, 5.8 percent than the same month last year. As a result, the number of hotel stakeholder guests fell 5.4 percent in the first quarter of 2025 and about 59 percent of visitors arrived at organized excursions and spent less than one day in the city. Mountain space "The search for accommodation will continue to overcome the offer in the coming years," warned Francis Lui. "If we cannot properly face the issue of accommodation of accommodation, the competitiveness of Macau (…), not only at the regional but also global level, can be harmed," said the businessman. Francis Lui admitted that the scarcity of land available in Macao is a challenge and pointed out as a possible “greater integration” solution with hengqin. On the other hand, the operator said the six dealers should "join to protect Macao's leadership position, not competing in prices but in the quality of the customer experience." Francis Lui spoke during the start of Global Gaming Expo Asia, the largest event in the game industry held in Macau, which will take place until tomorrow.

item.title: WYNN MACAU | Operational profits shrink more than one third
item.description:
Wynn Macao had $ 127.1 million operational profits in the first quarter, 38.3 percent in annual terms. The game operator learned in the two casinos that has $ 720 million in revenues, less 12.2 percent compared to the first three months of 2024
Wynn Macau yesterday announced financial results for the first quarter of 2025, which reveal a significant break from operational profits, less 38.3 percent, to a total of $ 127.1 million. According to a statement issued by the game concessionaire, the two properties operated by the company registered revenues of $ 865.9 million between January and March, a 13.3 percent drop compared to the same period of 2024. Betting in Wynn Macau and Wynn Palace casinos were responsible for the company's $ 720 million in revenues, 12.2 percent than in First quarter of last year. Craig Billings, a mother's executive director, American Wynn Resorts, said in the same statement that the big gamblers were more lucky than usual in the first quarter, something that "negatively affected the results." In this segment, known as VIP game, the bets decreased only 1.25 percent in the two Wynn Macau casinos, but the revenues fell much more, 34.4 percent in homologous terms, to $ 120.2 million. On average, Macao casinos manage to raise at least 3 percent of the bets in the VIP game, but this value fell to 1.09 percent in the first three months of the year, in the case of the Wynn Macao Casino. The so-called mass market continued to be from afar the main segment for the operator, representing revenues of $ 710.9 million between January and March, 6.9 percent less than in the same period as 2024. It is recalled that in 2019 VIP represented 46.2 percent of the total revenues of Macao casinos. But in the first three months of the year this segment was a slice of 25.1 percent. The world outside Wynn Resorts, which is building a Casino hotel in the United Arab Emirates, said it continues to "explore opportunities to develop more business or related games in the domestic and international market." In a teleconference with analysts, after the announcement of the results, Craig Billings, acknowledged that the company could compete for new concessions for casinos in Japan, but only "if the conditions were adequate." Billings also gave as an example Thailand, a country that is discussing the legalization of casinos and described as "an incredible market, with air transport, infrastructure, tourism, etc. unbelievable." Billings said he did not expect any impact on Wynn Macao from the trade war created by the tariffs imposed by the United States on imports from China, Hong Kong and Macau. On Tuesday, the Financial Notation Agency Fitch Ratings considered that the trade war could damage play operators in Macau, which are “subject to retaliation” and vulnerable to Chinese economic slowdown.

item.title: Auditors of Macau company accused of accounting accounts
item.description: Four Wellink CPA auditors and consultants are accused of having falsified Huarchi Global Group Holdings Limited accounts so that this Macao company could enter the Hong Kong bag. The case was revealed yesterday through a Hong Kong Independent Commission Against Corruption (ICAC) and is also being investigated in Macao. According to the results of the investigation that took place since 2021, auditors and consultants Lam Shui-Mei, Siu Yuen-Shan, Cha Wai-Lun and Wong Yat-Chung falsified Huarchi Global accounts to show fictitious economic growth and be admitted to the Hong Kong Stock Exchange. In addition, the four asked for the help of three family members, identified as Li Man-Heung, Li Kit-Chit and Wong Wing-Man, to subscribe to the company's first public offering. According to the Commissioner Against Corruption (CCAC), which assisted the ICAC in investigations, those involved in the purchase of shares received $ 1.5 million from Hong Kong. As a result, the four are accused of two conspiracy crimes to defraud the Hong Kong bag, while the three family members are accused of a conspiracy crime to defraud the Hong Kong bag. The seven will be present throughout this day to a Hong Kong court. However, the ICAC has admitted that investigations are still running and that there may be other accusations. Investigation in Macau In Macao, searches were performed at the headquarters of Huarchi Global Group Holdings Limited in the Plaza Civil Building. The president of the group appears identified in the 2021 company annual report as Lou Cheok Meng. The identity was not confirmed by the Macao corruption commissioner, who in a statement of the case confirmed that he was running an independent investigation in Macau. "This construction company is a local Macao company and its official is also a resident of Macao, so CCAC has established an investigation process following the respective indications of crime," he was reported. In addition, CCAC reported that the case continues to be investigated in the territory.

item.title: Timorese specialist considers urgent domain of Portuguese for national cohesion
item.description: Timorese linguist Benjamin Real Corte considered yesterday that the Portuguese language is a factor of cohesion in Timor-Leste and is a “national urgency” that all citizens will dominate. Benjamin Real Corte spoke at the seminar on “Linguistic Policies and Development of the Portuguese Language in Timor-Leste: Challenges and Perspectives”, organized by the National University of Timor-Leste, under his 25th anniversary and the celebrations of World Portuguese Language Day, which was signaled on May 5. In his speech, the teacher recalled that before the arrival of the Portuguese, the Timorese were scattered by tribal groups, who spoke their own language, and that the communities were isolated from each other, also because of the mountainous relief of the region. "The arrival of the Portuguese comes to bring a novelty that is the introduction of an element that will precisely dilute our previous situation of isolation of communities. Since the Portuguese language entered Timor, it has served this purpose of uniting the Timorese communicatively," said Benjamin Corte Real. And, according to the linguist, although it was not introduced in the same way as Indonesian language, whose learning was a matter of survival, the Timorenses, especially the leaders, realized that to unify the country and consolidate national independence to “Portuguese language was essential”. National urgency Another reason pointed out by Benjamin Real Cut for the importance of Portuguese for “national cohesion” is that maternal or local languages ​​do not “have enough resourcefulness to absorb administrative practice, for legislative production for territory planning”. Today, he stressed, although national cohesion has not been achieved in terms of widespread mastery of the Portuguese language, it has already begun to realize that the state must walk in this direction and make a "more proposed" effort so that Portuguese is dominated by all. “This is a national urgency. Therefore, we are here to appeal to all the instances of education throughout the territory that assume their responsibility and comply with the laws and enforce the laws around the implementation of Portuguese language teaching and teaching through Portuguese,” said Benjamim Corte Real. "We cannot speak of a harmonized, unified society, without investing in the language that is common to all of us. We must do it by obligation, national vocation, and, above all, also by constitutional mandate," he insisted.

item.title: India / Pakistan | International Community calls for containment
item.description:
Tuesday night's India attack against three Pakistan zones dangerously climbed the conflict between the two nuclear powers
The international community yesterday asked India and Pakistan to have military containment after the confrontation between the two nuclear powers, which has already caused dozens of civilians in both countries. China, Russia, France, and Germany asked for restraint and were concerned about climbing tensions, highlighting the need to avoid confrontation situations and protect civilians. Turkey also expressed concern and warned of the “risk of total war” between India and Pakistan. "The attack of India last night represents the risk of total war. We condemned this provocative attitude and attacks on civilians and civil infrastructure," the Ministry of Turkish Foreign Affairs said. Similarly, Iran expressed “deep concern” with the confrontation between India and Pakistan, a country with whom it borders. Earlier, the United States regretted the situation, with the president, Donald Trump, considered that the restart of clashes "was a pity" and advanced to expect "to stop very quickly." US diplomacy leader Marc Rubio also exhorted the leaders of both states to open a dialogue channel to avoid a greater escalation of the conflict. “The world cannot afford to luxury a military confrontation” between India and Pakistan, the UN Secretary General, António Guterres, said, referring to the attacks at the past few hours, the most serious of the last two decades between these states. In a more assertive reaction, the United Kingdom also asked for calm countries, but assumed it was ready to intervene if necessary. India and Pakistan have "interest in regional stability," said British Commerce Secretary Jonathan Reynolds, adding that the British government will do "everything it can in terms of dialogue to reduce tension." Killed and injured The two armies exchanged artillery shots along the border disputed in Caxemira after Indian attacks on Pakistani soil in retaliation by an attack on 22 April in India -controlled Caxemira, which killed 26 people. The tension between India and Pakistan rekindled on April 22, when gunmen attacked the tourist region of Pahalgam, in Caxemira Indiana, killing 26 civilians. The attack was attributed to the Lashkar-e-Taiba organization and the relations have deteriorated even more among these neighboring countries, rivals since they became independent of the United Kingdom in 1947. The two governments ordered the departure of their territories of citizens of the neighboring state and, over the days, incidents were registered at the borders, with shots fired in the so-called Caxemira control line. On Tuesday night, Nova Deli launched attacks against three areas of Pakistan, which, according to the Indian government, constituted “terrorist places” in Punjab province. A few hours later, the Pakistani government announced that it has slaughtered several Indian military aircraft, and yesterday morning, a sequence of bombing carried out by Islamabade and Nova Deli caused at least 38 dead in the biggest confrontation in the last 20 years.

item.title: Victory Day | Beijing justifies participation in the Moscow Parade as an act of respect for history
item.description: Beijing defended yesterday the presence of Chinese troops at the Military Parade of May 9 in Moscow as a demonstration of “respect for history” and not as a gesture of Russia support in the war in Ukraine. "China's participation in the 80th anniversary of the Soviet victory in the Great Patriotic War reflects respect for history and the firm determination to defend the achievements of World War II," Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Lin Jian said at a press conference. The spokesman recalled that the victory in war was "the result of the joint struggle of all countries and peoples lovers of peace and justice" and both the Chinese people and the people of the former Soviet Union "have made huge national sacrifices and indelible historical contributions." The comments came a day after Ukraine criticized the presence of foreign troops in the Parade of the Red Square as a “manifestation of support for the aggressor state”. Beijing avoided responding directly to Kiev's rebuke, but insisted that the position on the war "has been clear and consistent." "Avoiding a new climb of tensions is now the urgent priority. All parties involved must reach consensus and create conditions to achieve this goal," he added. Regarding bilateral cooperation between China and Russia, the spokesman reiterated that "it has always been based on the principles of mutual respect, shared benefit and common success." The parade in Moscow will also have military units from 12 more countries. Chinese President Xi Jinping will be present on the first visit to Russia since March 2023. A bilateral meeting with Russian President Vladimir Putin is also planned on May 8.

item.title: Economy | Chinese scholarships rise with Beijing stimulus measures
item.description: China's top scholarships yesterday opened with gains, following the announcement of a new package of measures by Beijing to boost economic recovery, pressured by the tariffs imposed by the United States. item.title: China asks for sincerity to the US for the meeting this weekend
item.description: China yesterday appealed to the United States to demonstrate “sincere conversations” planned weekend, stressing that it accepted the meeting based on its interests and expectations of the international community. "The United States must demonstrate sincerity in conversations, correct their wrong practices, find a point of balance with China and solve mutual concerns based on equality and respect," the Chinese Ministry of Commerce said in a statement. The ministry stressed that “all dialogue and negotiation should be based on the principle of mutual respect”, in reference to meetings that the vice-minister He Lifeng-China's main commercial negotiator-will have US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent on Saturday and Sunday in Switzerland. “In recent times, US guardians have been circulating information on possible adjustments to their tariffs and transmitted this intention to China by different channels, manifesting openness to dialogue,” reads in the statement. "Given global expectations, China's interests and US industry and consumer demands, China has decided to accept talking," he added. Rational The Ministry has accused the United States of adopting, since the return to the power of Donald Trump, "unilateral, illegal and unreasonable tariffs," which will have "severely affected bilateral economic and commercial relations, disturbed by international order and created serious obstacles to global economic recovery." "To defend its legitimate rights and interests, China has taken firm countereds. Our position is consistent: either in the confrontation, and in dialogue, China's determination to safeguard its development interests will not change, as it will not change its commitment to equity, justice and multilateralism," he said. The Chinese government has reiterated that it maintains the door open to dialogue, but warned that the United States must recognize "the negative impact of its unilateral tariffs," respect international economic standards and listen to "the rational voices of all sectors." But if the US "says one thing and do another" or resort to "coercion and blackmail under the disguise of negotiations," this is something that China "will never accept," said Beijing. "China will never sacrifice its principles or international justice in exchange for an agreement," he said. In the same note, the Ministry of Commerce has ensured that China will continue to work with other countries to “reinforce coordination, resist together unilateral protectionism and hegemonic intimidation, defend free trade and multilateralism, and promote inclusive and beneficial economic globalization”. Meeting in Switzerland The Ministry of Foreign Affairs confirmed yesterday that He Lifeng - the confidence figure of Chinese President Xi Jinping - will visit Switzerland between May 9 and 12 for meetings with Bessent, as part of efforts to relieve tension between the two powers. Bessent had already announced on Tuesday that he will meet with the Chinese delegation this weekend after having a video conferencing with He on February 25, during which they discussed fares and the fight against fentanyl trafficking, a powerful opiate. Also on Tuesday, Donald Trump stated that there would be negotiations "at the appropriate time". In recent days, Washington has indicated that there have already been previous contacts and Trump claimed to have spoken with Xi Jinping - something Beijing denied and that the White House did not clarify.

item.title: Trade War | China and Brazil pull through regional integration political face of the USA
item.description:
Lula da Silva will be in Beijing next week to participate in the China-Celac summit (Latin American and Caribbean Community). Given the aggressive economic policy of Donald Trump, Beijing and Brasilia hit the needles to continue to promote bilateral agreements that benefit both nations
The president of Brazil, Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva, travels next week to China, at a time when the two countries seek to deepen the regional integration of Latin America, in a context marked by the trade war triggered by Washington. Lula will participate in Beijing in the China-Celac summit (Latin American and Caribbean Community), scheduled for May 12 and 13, and also foreseen a bilateral meeting with Chinese counterparts, Xi Jinping. The trip coincides with the negotiations between Beijing and Brasilia about the eventual construction of a rail connection to the port of Chancay, built by China in Peru and opened in 2024. Last year, Xi and Lula established Brazil's integration into the Pacific as one of the four strategic pillars of sino-Brazilian relations, during a state visit from the Chinese leader to the South American country. According to the Chinese press, a Chinese delegation, consisting of 11 employees of the state company China State State Railway Group and the China Ministry of Transport, last month visited Brazil for “technical analysis”. Brazil already plays an important role in China's food safety, representing more than 20 percent of agricultural and livestock imports in the Asian country. The trade war triggered by US President Donald Trump is expected to further reinforce this demand. Washington has increased the rates on Chinese products up to 145 percent in recent weeks. Beijing retaliated with additional 125 percent rates on US products and suspended purchases of agricultural products. Brazilian Minister of Agriculture and Livestock, Carlos Fávaro, assured that Brazil will take advantage of all the opportunities generated by the trade war between Beijing and Washington. "From crises are born opportunities. And Brazil is aware of opportunities and will expand trade exchanges," he said, quoted by the Brazilian press. Collateral benefits Brazil has benefited from commercial disputes among the two largest economies in the world since the First Trade War, which began during Donald Trump's first presidential term (2017-2021). Since then, China has increased soy purchases to the country to reduce US dependence. In 2024, China imported a total of 105 million tons of soy, of which 22.14 million came from the US, representing 21.1 percent of the total - a drop of 13.3 percent compared to 2018. During the same period, Chinese soy imports in Brazil reached 74.65 million tons, now representing 71.1 percent of the total, according to data from Chinese customs. Access to the Pacific Ocean would allow Brazil and neighboring countries to get around the traditional sea routes of the Atlantic, significantly reducing traffic times and the logistical costs of agricultural exports such as soy, beef and cereal. Chancay Port can also help Beijing diversify maritime transportation options and reduce dependence on the Panama Canal, a route that accentuated diplomatic and geopolitical tensions with the United States. The strategic objectives of Beijing and Brasilia are part of Lula's politics for Celac. Lula promoted Brazil's return to the intergovernmental organization, after the country was withdrawn from the bloc in 2019. The movement signaled the resumption of regional integration as a priority of Brazilian foreign policy, through the South America Integration Routes project.

item.title: Gaza | Hamas warns that it is not worth negotiating new truce
item.description: A high Hamas employee said yesterday that the Palestinian group considers it useless at this stage negotiations for a truce in Gaza, and appealed to the world to press Israel to end the “hunger war” at the enclave. "It is not worth starting negotiations or examining new ceasefire proposals while the Hunger War and the Gaza Extermination War continues," France-Presse (AFP) Bassem Naïm, a member of the Hamas political office, told the agency. "The world must press the government of Netanyahu to end the crimes of hunger, thirst and murder," he added. The statements appear a day after the Israelite government announced a new military campaign in the Gaza Strip, which provides for the conquest of the territory. The Gaza Strip, where the inhabitants have been displaced several times, has been under a blockade of Israel since March 2 and crosses a serious humanitarian crisis. Gaza Civil Defense spokesman Mahmoud Baçal said yesterday that three Palestinians were killed following Israeli bombing at dawn in different parts of the Gaza Strip. The Israelite army resumed the enclave offensive on March 18, ending a two -month truce. The war was triggered by Hamas's unprecedented attack on Israel on October 7, 2023, which caused the death of 1,218 people on the Israeli side, mostly civilians, according to an AFP count based on official data. Of the 251 kidnapped people, 58 remain arrested in Gaza, 34 of which were declared killed by the Israelite army. Hamas also maintains the remains of an Israeli soldier killed during a previous war in Gaza in 2014. The Israeli retaliation campaign made at least 52,567 killed in Gaza, most of Civil, according to Hamas Ministry of Health, considered UN reliable.

item.title: Victory Day | China sends guard of honor to parades in Moscow
item.description: The China army will send a guard of honor to the Victory Day parades in Moscow, where Chinese President Xi Jinping should attend the Russian homologist Vladimir Putin in Red Square. The China Ministry of Defense announced on Monday that it will send a guard of honor to participate in the military parades in the capitals of Russia and Belarus, to mark the 80th anniversary of the defeat of Germany Nazi, which is celebrated this Friday. Beijing sent Moscow Honor Guards to a Victory Day commemorative parade in 2015, but this will be the first time a Chinese guard of honor will participate in a similar event in Minsk. According to Chinese analysts, the gesture aims to demonstrate support for the International Order of Post World War, which Beijing considers to be under threat. Videos released on Chinese social networks showed the rehearsals of Chinese soldiers in Minsk and Moscow last week. As part of the preparations for the Moscow Parade, Chinese soldiers rehearsed the “Guerrilla Song” in Red Square on Sunday, described the Global Times, the Chinese Communist Party's official newspaper. The patriotic song describes the difficulties faced by Chinese soldiers during the Japanese invasion. Official News Agency Xinhua said this year is important to China and Russia, as well as “all those who love peace around the world,” as it also marks the 80th anniversary of the end of the invasion of Japan in China. Xinhua added that China and Russia will "defend written history with blood and lives, and oppose any attempt or behavior that seeks to deny, distort or falsify the history of World War II." Beijing had already announced that Xi will visit Russia between Wednesday and Saturday, and will maintain a “strategic dialogue” with Putin.

item.title: Álvaro Barbosa, vice-rector of the University of São José: “Student visa is very limiting”
item.description:
The University of São José continues the negotiation saga with the Chinese authorities to recruit students from the interior of China. Vice-rector Álvaro Barbosa expects, soon, the increase in master's students from 30 to 200. Regarding the internationalization of higher education, the official advocates changes in student visas to facilitate recruitment
Does the recruitment of students from the interior of China remain a matter pending to the University of Saint Joseph? It is a process that is underway. We have had huge support from the Macao government in negotiations to obtain the quota for our university, and they have been tireless in the effort to try to resolve the issues raised by the central government. Many of the questions are legitimate and concern concerns that arise. We were granted a temporary quota of 30 students for masters ago over a probative period, which served to evaluate how we, as Western University, would host students from China. From China, there is this concern with the host of students in Macau. I think we have made a huge effort and the students who are there, included in this contingent, are quite satisfied. Is this quota for masters just? Yes. For a degree we do not have authorization yet. In this way, we are currently at the time we try to overcome this probative period in order to obtain a quota of about 200 students for masters. We are in the final phase of the evaluation process and everything has been doing well. We will have the possibility that, next academic year, expand this quota. That would be great, because for our university, to have a greater impact of our mission in Macao, it is essential to have access to students from mainland China. We cannot be a university in an integrated region in a country like China, and not contact with students from China. Is it more difficult for USJ to compete with other universities, such as those of Hong Kong, by foreign students, outside China? The issue of recruitment of international students has become a priority for Macao universities. In the last two or three years, it has become evident that this internationalization is very important. What difficulty is there? There is the issue related to student visas, as these visas currently do not allow students to do any kind of work, denying them that minimum local subsistence mechanism to be able to meet expenses. Nor is it contemplated the possibility of, when the student concludes his formation, to be in the territory and find work. What all countries and regions that are competitive in higher education do, such as Singapore, Hong Kong or Australia, is to have incentive policies. Allow students to work part -time, for example. In Hong Kong when a degree ends, the student can stay in the territory up to a maximum of two years to find a job. This kind of measures do not yet exist in Macau, but I think the government is pondering this possibility. From the moment the decision was made that the internationalization of higher education was important, this must be accompanied with the corresponding measures. The current student visa is extremely limiting and does not encourage the coming to Macao to study, only allows coming. This issue was not as present as it is now, but now there is a strategic policy of internationalization. It is also a matter of survival for local universities. Yes. Perhaps there is no greater example of a catalyst for the diversification of Macau's economy than higher education. We have ten institutions, 60,000 students in about 700,000 inhabitants. This is the potential of internationalization, to foster diversification.
And also the research that comes out of higher education. The investigation, the dynamics of the work that is done. There are a number of vectors that higher education brings to a region or country, this happened to Portugal, for example, with the policy of doctoral scholarships for students from abroad, which completely changed the dynamics of higher education. Cape Verde developed thanks to the impact of higher education. Then we need to make the system more flexible in Macau. I don't know if it's a matter of having a holistic view of strategy. There may be an idea, but then it does not intervene in all the necessary dimensions to achieve a certain goal. But I am very optimistic. I believe this new student policy is a key step to be taken in Macau. The internationalization strategy followed by all these countries and regions I spoke, and were successful in capturing international students, was always the same. No need to invent much. First, one should increase the capacity and notoriety of universities, and then a policy of scholarships, which will enhance a student flow, creating a reference for the territory, so that studying there becomes a habit. After this flow of students for a few years, an image is already created and some scholarships can be removed, which students will continue to choose a particular territory to study in it. Australia has a huge higher education industry, for example, and I think that in Macau we just have to follow the same strategies. We do, at USJ, that a little. How, in concrete terms? We offer many scholarships, and in this sense the Diocese of Macao has helped us build this flow of international students that allow us to create this dynamic that we hope will be sustainable by itself in the future. I think the government is also doing this. There have always been scholarships in Macau, attributed mainly by the Macau Foundation, but this measure will be strengthened. Solving the student's visa issue, creating a scholarship incentive system for five to ten years, Macau will have a bright future as an international higher education destination. But we need to invest, continue, and it takes a few years. USJ created the “Macau Hub” platform, in partnership with the Macau Scientific and Cultural Center (CCCM) in 2023. At what stage is this project? This project has to do with our interest in developing a relationship dynamic of Lusophone countries centered in Lisbon in the area of ​​entrepreneurship, first. This cabinet we have at CCCM is not intended to offer training in Portugal, but we want to do something else. As we are positioned in the Great Bay and with Hengqin, where it is intended to activate a business ecosystem, we want to take advantage of the fact that we have relations with the Lusophone world to activate the access of the startups of Portugal, Brazil and Angola, above all, to the great bay and hengqin. We are trying to create a kind of incubator of transnational companies, in which we support the development of Lusophone businesses that want to settle in the large bay and also the reverse system. Strategically, for a university, it is absolutely fundamental to have a dynamic in the area of ​​entrepreneurship. Currently, more than half of our students do not want to go to the corporate world, but create their own businesses. Just as universities have to have employability solutions, they also have to have them for entrepreneurs, who are increasingly. So a university has to have a business incubator. My vision of the future for higher education goes around: a university, besides having a library and canteen, will also have its own business incubator. I would say that most students of management or economy courses dream of having their own business, especially in China. China is perhaps one of the most entrepreneurial countries in the world. The CCCM welcomes this initiative in Portugal, but we also work with the Portuguese Catholic University. And concrete results, already have it? We have a number of small initial projects that are starting now, and we also work with many business organizations. We have now negotiated a series of projects, and I think everything will develop very quickly, based on the manifestations of interest we have. We were in Angola in December and we have already aligned a series of initiatives, we also have projects with Brazil and Portugal.

item.title: Adelina Moura, teacher and trainer: “The mobile phone is like a Swiss knife”
item.description:
Graduated in the area of ​​educational technologies, Adelina Moura will conduct lectures to parents, students and teachers about the use of digital technologies in classrooms, within the “Letters & Company” festival of the Portuguese Institute of the East. The teacher understands that prohibiting mobile phone in schools is not a solution
What are the challenges felt by teachers with the introduction of technologies in the classroom? Can the mobile phone actually be a complement to learning? Yes. I've been saying this since 2005. The mobile phone can be an excellent learning tool, a means to motivate students and to enrich their learning. We have a kind of Swiss knife here, a very powerful equipment in the hands of the students and there is a school failure, because they do not work and help students enhance this equipment they have. What happens is that students learn in the worst way, in a destructed way, by attempt-rrove. There is a gap, as students are not alerted to the positive potential for mobile phone use. They face their mobile phones as a free time use, spending time on social networks and scrolling, and time consumes. It is essential that teachers are users, in their practices, mobile phones, and for the preparation of classes and other projects, to know how to prepare students. I consider that the school has lost several stages of students' preparation and awareness to use these equipment that lead to classes and with which schools have not spent any money. With the prohibition of bringing the mobile phone to the classroom we did not advance anything in this regard. During the pandemic period, for example, the use of technologies, with distance learning, was quite enhanced. But during the pandemic we also burned some steps regarding the use of digital by teachers, because before the pandemic many teachers did not believe or used. They thought it was a fashion and they saw no use in the use of mobile phones and other technologies. With the pandemic the use of these equipment proved that without them the situation of education would have been much worse. In these pandemic years, teachers have become more aware of the technologies that already exist and are available to anyone. With internet access on mobile phone, something that has existed since 2007 with the launch of the first iPhone, the e-learning system is enhanced and then we move to “Mobile Learning”, where you can learn anywhere and anytime with mobile devices. It is this reality that we see a little away from school. And after the pandemic, how has it been? I think we will take a few more steps towards digital literacy. With Artificial Intelligence (IA), it seems that we are as in the phase I created my first website in 1999 or email in 1995. We are at the beginning. But it is 30 years of technology where there have been many changes, and technology in fact goes on and if we immediately do not realize what we have available, we and students, we help create a moat that has happened in the past compared to digital. In the face of AI, if we do not look back and do not realize what was not done and should have been at school level, we are wasting time. Only a few years from now will people be alert to AI, and the gap is increasing. Hence it is very important to bet now, in this early stage, in the training of teachers, students and families. Is there much ignorance of parents, removal from this reality? We have parents who are from this century. That is, they were born with the existence of computers, internet, saw the appearance of the smartphone. But when they studied, the school did not talk about the potential of digital. So these former students came to society and did not bring this sensitivity to digital, to educate their children. We teachers, when we do digital training, are doing good to society because we are also preparing these young people for the future, because they will be parents and should be aware of educating their children. At school we do not only prepare for the job market, but for personal and family life. Hence teacher education is essential. The invitation I received from IPOR seems to me an excellent holistic view of everything, because the school includes several actors, connecting with society. How should AI be introduced into the classroom? We currently watch changes in search engines, in fact. We have search engines created from root to Age Age, for example. The best way to introduce AI into the classroom is to ask students and how they use it, and already resort to this tool. At the beginning of the academic year I always ask students to answer a questionnaire about their digital routines, and then I know more or less their practices. In 2023, when the chatgPT came out, I introduced AI in my classes, and realized that students were using this tool to deceive the teachers. Students have to realize that when using AI, they are falling into a certain trap because they are not learning. It is the law of the lowest effort, equal to the phase in which the internet emerged, when students selected, copied and sent to the teacher. We now have the problem that the answers are in Brazilian Portuguese, for example, and see as soon as I was used. We have, therefore, to dismantle this action in the heads and face them. I tell them that they are being intellectually dishonest and that they have not read the AI ​​response, for example. Since 2023, I feel that students, in the answers to this questionnaire I do, say they are afraid to use chatgpt because they are afraid of being caught by teachers. That is, it seems to have gained some conscience. It will give these lectures in a different educational context in Asia, where the use of mobile phone can be earlier. How will you deal with these differences, or do you understand that the problems of using technology in the classroom are transversal? It is a transverse question. Do we have to wonder if the use of a particular equipment and tool will make us wiser? It seems to me not, because we may have the equipment, but the use we make it varies a lot. I tell my students that they should be ashamed, because they have much easier access to content than in my time, when we truly had to do research and read in physical format. I tell them that with this technology they should all have a grade 20, and that they are wasting resources, being dishonest intellectually, because they sign works that are not theirs and do not read, even, they deliver. One of the works we have with students is to teach them how to make bibliographic references, refer to the sources. But I am an optimistic by nature, and I hope that in a decade, secondary education students who are fathers and mothers will be able to deal with these problems of social networks and increase fraud with their children. It is this “parents school” that the school can help create. We are in a moment with no return of digital, and forbidding is the most comfortable situation, but it is not the best to face reality. We have to use the right words to alert. We have in this time of alerts and consciences, encouraging the critical spirit of our students, which is little today.
